info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 31 at 1:55PM MDT until July 31 at 3:45PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 345 PM MDT THIS AFTERNOON FOR CENTRAL LARIMER COUNTY... At 155 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 0.4 and 1.0 inch of rain has fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. The heaviest rain occurred about 5 miles northwest of northwest of Masonville. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Although the thunderstorms have shifted east of the burn area, runoff from those storms will likely cause flash flooding of small creeks and streams, gulches, roads, and poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Pennock Pass, Pingree Park and Masonville. This includes the following additional locations... Box Prairie, Upper Buckhorn along County Road 44H, Moondance Way, Stringtown Gulch, Big Bear, Lower Buckhorn on County Road 27 above Masonville, Crystal Mountain, Poudre Springs, Monument Gulch, Jacks Gulch, Upper Pingree Park Road, Lower Pingree Park Road, Sky Ranch, The Retreat and Storm Mountain. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Move to higher ground now. Act quickly to protect your life. Heavy Rainfall will cause flash flooding of small creeks, streams, and ditches in the affected part of the Cameron Peak burn area. Rock slides or debris flows can also be expected across rural roads.
